DOC.brief_summary: The objective study compare radiation dose 100kV scan protocol standard 120kV scan protocol . We hypothesize 100kV scan protocol associate reduction dose estimate least 20 % , diagnostic image quality inferior . Secondary endpoint study include quantitative image quality parameter , diagnostic accuracy 120 vs.100kV study compare invasive angiography patient underwent subsequent invasive coronary angiography
DOC.brief_title: Prospective Randomized Trial On RadiaTion Dose Estimates Of CT AngIOgraphy In PatieNts Scanned With A 100kV Protocol
DOC.detailed_description: All patient schedule coronary CT scan screen inclusion exclusion criterion . Patients include stable sinus rhythm ( heart rate < 100 bpm ) body weight < 90 kg body mass index ( BMI ) < 30 . Informed signed consent obtain patient CT scan prepare . After topogram scan native scan Ca-Scoring , patient randomize two group use sealed envelope . After contrast-enhanced coronary CT angiography perform 120kV- 100kV-protocol . The CT examination evaluate two experienced investigator per-vessel basis result study-related data collect dedicated database . For assessment image quality , previously establish 4-point score system use quantitative image quality parameter measure . A 30 day follow-up CT examination aim evaluate patient underwent invasive coronary angiography schedule myocardial stress / perfusion test ( stress-echocardiography , myocardial scintigraphy stress perfusion image MRI ) .
DOC.criteria: patient indication coronary CT angiography ( plan evaluation coronary artery ) stable sinus rhythm patient weight < 90kg body mass index < 30 kg/m2 sign informed consent nonECG trigger study noncoronary CTA study , e.g . bypass graft CTAs , pre post EP study , CABG planning study
